newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX sets May 27 as move date to new facility.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX sets May 27 as move date to new facility.

text.p: The New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) said in a statement Thursday that trading and back office operations will begin in its new facility in the World Financial Center in New York City on May 27.
The decision to build the new facility in lower Manhattan was announced on August 4, 1994, retaining 8,100 jobs in New York, the statment said.
The new building is 16 stories high and 500,000 square feet, including two 25,000 square foot trading floors, one for the exchange's COMEX division and one for its NYMEX division.
The building will also include a visitor's museum as well as observation galleries for both trading floors, all open to the public free of charge.

NYMEX is the largest energy and precious metals exchange in the world, offering trading in crude oil, natural gas, heating oil, gasoline, electricity, propane, gold, silver, copper, platinum and paladium.
The new address will be One North End Avenue, World Financial Center, New York, New York, 10282. The main phone number will be 212-299-2000.
